page.title: 02DUNKERTON VILLAGE
page.content: Dunkerton is a small dormitory village on the Cam brook. Because the brook floods in the winter the buildings are set back from the banks. The buildings are almost all old stone houses, cottages and farm buildings, together with a row of about ten council houses Some of the cottages have been substantially extended and other buildings such as an old coach-house have been converted to houses. Apart from two farming families, who have lived there for two generations, almost all the population has arrived quite recently. There are now only two working farms, both outside the village, those in the village being just houses. Most people go to work in Bath, a few to Bristol or elsewhere. There is no employment in the village.
